meanings.definition: In relation to geography or the physical features of a region.
meanings.sent1: The geographically diverse landscape of the country attracts many tourists.
meanings.sent2: She studied the geographically distinct regions of the world in her geography class.
meanings.sent3: The geographically challenging terrain made the hiking trip both exciting and exhausting.
meanings.sent4: His geographically scattered family members lived in different countries around the world.
meanings.sent5: The geographically isolated island was a paradise for those seeking solitude.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the location or arrangement of places on Earth.
meanings.sent1: The team mapped out the route geographically before starting their journey.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to explore the world geographically, visiting every continent.
meanings.sent3: The GPS device guided them geographically through the winding roads of the countryside.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of the world expanded geographically as he traveled to new countries.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden geographically in a remote cave deep in the mountains.
